column5: I know I'm going out on a bit of a limb here posting a pic of my new truck because of some past posts I've read about some unhappy Dodge owners here, but I thought what the heck. When it comes time for me to buy a new vehicle I feel I have to be loyal to Chrysler, they have been my sole employer for the past 28 years and I have had pretty good luck with their vehicles, none have been perfect and I don't expect this one will be either, but I will say for 2010 there seems to be some improvements time will tell!

wow, very sexy looking truck indeed. I wouldn't second Dodge as a good manufacturer. It all depends on how you use, operate and maintain your vehicle.  Thanks for sharing, looks like it will be fun to drive! MTBF
Mighty Dodge!!  What are ya towing?
man nice truck i love that color
I AM RAM !!!!!! nice ride ...
Very nice ride. My buddy has one and is very happy with it. Happy Trails Ted

How Ya doin Sinker? I'm not towing anything real big 3 to 4 thousand pounds but often usually a couple times a month down the 401 but that was at the upper end for my 6 cylinder Dakota I traded in. This truck may be a bit over kill but it will be nice to have the extra power especially when the winds are blowing hard out of the west like the usually are on the way home.
Nice one ....
Nice Truck!
What a beauty! Congrats.
Nice Truck. Like the color
nice truck!!  my dodge (jeep) has been rock solid for me. 270k+ kms.
"HEY BUDDY, THAT THING GOT A HEMI IN IT?"  When are you and Lew racing for pinks?  Nice ride, I too like the colour.  Tom
Good stuff!  Nice to hear the loyalty story   The blue has been very popular here at the dealership...lots of folks have had to settle for other colours.
I like my Dodge just fine!!  BTW Nice truck!
Thanks Guys for the great comments, I hope it takes me and my family out for many fishing trips in the years to come!
I think you should hook up a chain between it and Lew's new truck and have a pull off!
Somebody also suggested racing for pink slips    both these ideas would make great you-tube videos but speaking for myself I couldn't do it till that new truck smell is gone!

I'm doin good George!  You won't even know your towing anything that size with the new dodge! Major improvement over the old dakota!!! Your gonna love it! The only trucks I've NEVER had any issues with, were dodge.  S.
i loved my dodge. i had 2 cummins. now a happy jeep owner. 2 years old never been back to the dealer. thats a quality statement.

Nice truck! Nice to see some loyalty to the one who puts the food on your plate. It bugs me when I see my sister-in-law's husband buy foreign a he works at Ford. A Mercedes, an Accord and a Canadian made Chrysler. Mind you he didn't drive any of those to work, too far to walk from the outcast parking I assume. He did break down though and bought a new Escape last summer. She said he didn't like paying for the repairs on the German car. Plus all the flack too.
I'd rather have a V8 workin than a V6 workin too hard.  Wish my truck was an 8. Beauty truck man
